articles.title: Photos from the UC-wide Union Strike
articles.description: On November 20, members of the AFSCME 3299 and UC Student Workers Union UAW 2865 from nine UC campuses went on strike to protest grievances by the UC administration.
articles.content:
On November 20, members of the AFSCME 3299 and UC Student Workers Union UAW 2865 from nine UC campuses went on strike to protest grievances by the UC administration.  Several Nexus photographers were on hand to capture various images of the protests that day.

The related Nexus article can be read here:

Photo Credits: Eric Swenson, Peter Vandenbelt, Cameryn Brock

Striking AFSCME 3299 union members and its supporters march down Storke Plaza during the UC-wide protests by members of AFSCME 3299 and UAW 2865 on November 20, 2013. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

Union members and supporters strike in front of Elings Hall near the Henley Gate in early morning. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

A driver for a linen and uniform service company pauses on the road–creating a ten-car traffic in the process–to show his solidarity and shake the hand of one of the leaders of the strike. The photographer noted that the driver proceeded to park his truck, and come out of his work uniform to join the strike. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A speaker rallies striking union members its supporters during the UC-wide protests on November 20, 2013. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A union worker of the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees 3299 urges passing motorists to honk their horns in support for the striking workers in front of Elings Hall near the Henley Gate in the east side of the UCSB Campus. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

Two bicyclists–one of them visibly engaged by the ongoing strike–ride by protesters on the bike path by Storke Tower. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

Student workers of the Associated Students ticket office observe protesters–seen in the reflections of the windows–marching by Corwin Pavilion during the UC-wide AFSCME 3299 union strike on November 20, 2013. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A member of the UC Student Workers Union UAW 2865 protests alongside AFSCME 3299 protesters in front of Storke Tower during the midday. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

A union member of the AFSCME 3299 rallies the crowd with a loudspeaker in front of Elings Hall during the November 20 UC-wide protests against the UC Administration. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

Striking union members and supporters for the AFSCME 3299 union gather in front of Storke Tower. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

A striking AFSCME 3299 union member gives an interview for the television crew of KEYT of Santa Barbara in front of Elings Hall during the November 20 UC-wide protests. Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

A UCSB student bicycles by striking union members in front of Storke Tower. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

Print

A cool team of photographers who preserves the visual memory of UCSB and Isla Vista.

articles.title: Week in Photos: Nov. 11-17
articles.description: Zombies, red cards, disposable sheet music: a look at this week’s photos.  Credits: Peter Vandenbelt, Kenneth Song, John Clow, and Benjamin Pu
articles.content:
Zombies, red cards, disposable sheet music: a look at this week’s photos. 

Credits: Peter Vandenbelt, Kenneth Song, John Clow, and Benjamin Pu

UCSB’s junior defender Kevin Garcia-Lopez reacts upon receiving a red card during UCSB’s 3-2 loss to CSUN in a Big West semifinal soccer match. Garcia Lopez and All-Freshmen midfielder Drew Murphy–who also received a red card–will have to sit out UCSB’s next match.
Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

The United Students Against Sweatshops (USAS) organization of UCSB protested poor working conditions and worker deaths (“The Tragedies of Our Apparel) in the Arbor during UCSB’s Human Rights week.
Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

The Cabinet of Wonders, which was hosted by Wesley Stace, performs in Campbell Hall on Wednesday. The show featured Eugene Mirman and a variety of musicians, writers, comedians and raconteurs.
Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

 

Two bicyclists ride towards Isla Vista after classes were dismissed in the five o’clock hour.
Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

 

A violinist shreds sheet music after a single play in accordance to the rules of an exhibit titled “Perishable Music” in front of Lotte Lehman Concert Hall.
John Clow/Daily Nexus

A student takes a brief break from studying inside the Davidson Library.
John Clow/Daily Nexus

Three “zombies” pose for the camera during UCSB’s first Zombie Survival 5K run on Saturday. In the 5K run, “survivors” attempt to finish the course while avoiding infection from designated “zombies” that lurked anywhere in the run. The event was hosted by the RHA.
Benjamin Pu/Daily Nexus

Freshman point guard Eric Childress goes for a layup during the UCSB-Utah State basketball game in the Thunderdome. Childress came off the bench to score seven points, five assists, four rebounds and two steals for the Gauchos.
Peter Vandenbelt/Daily Nexus

articles.title: The Nexus Looks Back: This Year in Photos
articles.description: By Jonathon Cuong A diaper-clad reveler chats with law enforcement on Halloween weekend. This year’s Halloween festivities resulted in 196 jail bookings and 249 citations.   By Benjamin Pu ...
articles.content:
By Jonathon Cuong

A diaper-clad reveler chats with law enforcement on Halloween weekend. This year’s Halloween festivities resulted in 196 jail bookings and 249 citations.

 

By Benjamin Pu

Incumbent Lois Capps (D.) and former Lieutenant Governor Abel Maldonado (R.) squared off in UCSB’s Pollock Theater in a debate for the 24th District Congressional seat.

 

Photo by Kenneth Song

UCSB senior defender Peter McGlynn was arrested after he pushed down a referee at the conclusion of the UCSB men’s soccer game against UC Davis in October.

 


Photo by Magali Gauthier

Thousands of UCSB students aimed for viral fame with the campus’s own version of the Harlem Shake internet meme.

 

Photo by Alex Gonzales

The 2nd annual Gauchella festival brought together a range of campus performing arts groups. .

 

Photo by Audrey Bachelder

“If you’re going to make movies for yourself, you better love your shit. You better get off 24/7 to your own movies … and that’s what I do.”
-Quentin Tarantino, during an appearance at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival in February.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

The 22nd annual Reel Loud Film Festival showcased students’ seven-minute-or-less silent film projects in May. “The Film & Media department’s annual exhibition of student shorts is easily the most anticipated and unique local event for film-lovers.”-Artsweek‘s Corie Anderson.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Best Coast performing in the Hub.

 

Photo by Kenneth Song

UCSB Battle of the Bands Winner Alpha Phunk

 

Photo courtesy of Robert Clayton

The balcony of a Del Playa house collapsed during a Deltopia day party with at least four reported as seriously injured. Lawsuits ensued.

 

Photo by Kenneth Song

Deltopia 2013 attracted an estimated 15,000-18,000 partygoers–more than any past year.

 

Photo courtesy of Ailea Richter

A backflip off a mail truck during Deltopia 2013.

 
Photo by John Clow

Hundreds of students attended A.S. Senate meetings to voice their opinions on a proposed resolution to divest from companies that “profit from the military occupation of Palestine.”

 

Photo courtesy of Sally Oh

Students gather to protest the A.S. Senate’s decision to strike the revised divestment resolution from the agenda.

 

Photo by Mark Brocher

A.S.elections yielded an OPP sweep of all five Executive Board positions and all Senate positions except one.

 

Photo by Mark Brocher

The Daily Nexus was reaffirmed.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Headliner Radical Something performing at Chilla Vista 2013.

 

Photo by Mark Brocher

Seth Rogen, Craig Robinson and Danny McBride made a brief appearance at UCSB to promote an advanced screening of their movie This Is The End.

 

Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Kendrick Lamar at Extravaganza 2013.

 


Photo by Peter Vandenbelt

Dada Life gets intimate.
